data.meta_site_name: Obituary for Sharon Herr | July 18, 2022 | Shirley & Stout, Hasler & Stout, Stout & Son Funeral Homes
data.text:
Sharon June Herr entered the Church Triumphant on Monday July 18, 2022, at her home after a brief battle with cancer. She was born on September 18, 1940, to the late James and Myrtlebelle Pedue in Michigan City, Indiana. Sharon graduated from Elston High School in 1959. Upon graduation from Indiana State University in 1966, Sharon married Ralph Paul Herr Jr who survives her.

Ralph and Sharon were married for 56 years and had two children: son, Larry Herr and daughter Nancy (John) Robertson, two grandsons Tanner and AJ Robertson. She has one sister Sandie Casey and two nieces Jamie and Tammy. She is preceded in death by her parents.

Sharon was a teacher in the Kokomo Center School corporation and retired in 2003. She taught special education at Pettit Park Elementary School and finished her career as a guidance counselor at Kokomo Downtown campus and Kokomo High School. Sharon returned to work post retirement at Bona Vista teaching preschool.

Being the hands and feet of Jesus was important to Sharon and she strived to serve in some way every day. Sharon was a member of South Side Christian Church for 56 years with strong friendships spanning that time. She was a Sunday School teacher, Church Elder, Steven Minister and served in capacities with the annual rummage sale. Sharon was also involved with the Migrant School, CWF and Baby University.

Sharon had a special knack of convincing others to help her in outreach and worked with friends to establish the Giving Tree, Little Library and Little Pantry all connected to the Church Garden. In these efforts over 1,000 coats and cold weather gear are keeping people warm. Sharon has worked daily in the church garden for the last 10 years. She enjoyed the friendships she made while working in Garden pulling stubborn weeds and coaxing flowers to bloom. Sharon didn’t consider herself a natural gardener, but she did see how the garden could minister to others.

In addition to her Church activities Sharon was a member of Delta Kappa Gamma and volunteered regularly at the Kokomo Urban Outreach food pantry. Sharon was a huge Purdue fan and was a regular at Purdue football and basketball games for 25 years.

Sharon earned Super Fan status from endless hours spent at swim meets with her children and then later her grandsons.

A special thank you to family and friends for the outpouring of support over the past week. In leu of flowers please consider a donation to the Little Pantry at South Side Christian Church. in Sharon’s name.

A funeral service will be held at 11 am on Friday July 22, 2022, at South Side Christian Church, 201 E. Markland Ave, Kokomo, with Pastor Rex Kibler officiating. Burial will follow in Albright Cemetery. Friends may visit with the family from 5 pm to 8 pm on Thursday, July 21, 2022, at Shirley & Stout Funeral Home & Crematory, 1315 W. Lincoln Rd., Kokomo. Messages of condolence may be left online at www.shirleyandstout.com.
